ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing: It's a trap.

ScenarioFile.Name: Tower Melbourne Runway 16A27D - Advanced
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Melbourne Tower. Ground and Delivery are offline.
Runway 16 is in use for arrivals, Runway 27 for departures. Instrument approaches are in use due to a low cloud base.
Melbourne Approach is online.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All arrivals are cleared the approach and will land automatically. Arrivals from the east may briefly lose identification approaching BOOIN due terrain. They will return prior to entering the TMA.
**QFA402** incorrect hemispherical level.
**JCR** has filed via `RPY` which is not in the current AIRAC. Students will need to reclear them `IGNES DCT AV` and update FDR.
**VOZ810** conflicts with **RXA102** on approach. Student to either impose speed control ('reduce to final approach speed', 'best speed to the field', etc) or issue a go around. To remove conflict, delete VOZ810.

ScenarioFile.Name: Tower Brisbane Runway 19L/R - Advanced
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Brisbane Tower. Ground and Delivery are offline.
Runway 19L and R are in use for arrivals and departures. Instrument approaches are in use due to a low cloud base.
Brisbane Approach is online.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All arrivals are cleared the approach and will land automatically. Aircraft for runway 19L from the northwest may not be visible on surveillence until entering the TMA due terrain. Use the simulator map if required.
This is a busy scenario with a full arrival sequence to both runways. Suggest instructors leave the sim paused to process airways clearances or delete the first few aircraft if the student is a beginner.
**POL31** for an overfly at A015. Cancel auto-release with the student when appropriate. You will be prompted for coordination.
**SH133** and **UTY1720** get quite close on the approach, providing a chance for the student to issue speed instructions ('reduce final approach speed', 'maintain best speed to the field', etc) or issue a go around.
**JST811** has filed a non-jet route.

**JST779** has planned a non-jet route at a non-hemispherical level.
The session runs for 45 minutes.

ScenarioFile.Name: Tower Launceston Runway 32L
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
**HANDOVER** - **Runway**: - 32L at YPAD - Expect Instrument Approach. - **Airspace**: - LT APP online - **Weather**: - Cloud BKN020 - QNH 1013 - **Frequencies**: - 118.7 only - **Traffic**: - No one in contact yet. No clearances have been issued, haven't received coordination on any arrivals
Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes: - Cloud is **BKN020**, so ATC Visual Separation is available in ADC airspace, however, not available at or above A020. - **VOZ1373** Has flight planned incorrectly, and should be passed an amended route by the student. - **AM773** will depart on the same route, in front of **QFA7367**. The student should ideally recognise this situation, and provide at least **90 second** separation between the departures, even though it is not technically their responsibility for separation. - **FD714** is inbound for the DGA, so the student should give circuit joining instructions upon receiving Heads-up Coordination. The aircraft will descend assuming it will join a *left mid-field crosswind* Runway 32L. If the student coordinates something else, manual control must be taken of the aircraft with headings. - **UMG** is a VFR inbound from the North. Will need circuit joining instructions - **XGA** is a VFR overflier from the West. They will request Climb when overhead YMLT. This will need to be coordinated to LT APP. - **OMQ** is a VFR departure in to CTA. This will need to be coordinated to LT APP prior to issuing clearance.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Adelaide - Intro
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
YPAD Information A. EXP INST APCH. RWY23. OVC038. QNH 1010.
This is an introductory scenario to TMA controlling. It covers a majority of the new concepts for S3 students.
**RGX** should request flight following shortly after scenario begin, and terminate approaching the TMA boundary.
**WZA** will enter at 4000ft. Talk through with student what being at this altitude means in terms of identification and control services. What if they wanted to climb to 5000ft. Leave them at 4000ft to conflict with VFR traffic **SRP** who spawns later. Approaching YGWA, assign the aircraft YGWA Runway 19. Cancel SARWATCH upon landing.
**URT** should depart at approximately 7 minutes.
**QFA723** departs at 12 minutes to conflict with **RXA3458** on arrival.
**SRP** is a VFR Cessna 182, POB, overhead Strathalbyn, tracking Mount Bold Reservoir, 3500ft, received A, request clearance. Discuss what options you have for sequencing VFR traffic against the arrival flow.
**AYZ** will need to be coordinated prior to boundary, and handed off early to allow student to provide an airways clearance.
**URT** control services must be terminated when handed off to ML CTR.
**ZLE**, **JST682** and **TGG521** arrive within a 3 minute window and allow an introduction to basic sequencing using speed, vectors or both.
**AYZ** requests vectors for ILS Runway 23.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Adelaide - Advanced
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
Ensure the student disables GRIB winds.
YPAD Information A. EXP INST APCH. RWY23. OVC038. QNH 1010.
This scenario extends on the introduction scenario for Adelaide. It includes a more complex traffic scenario. Intent is to see additional conflicts, more IFR OCTA traffic, and develop the students ability to scan and predict upcoming issues. This scenario includes prompts on when to depart aircraft, conduct coordination, or request specific events.
**LOU** should be set to 110 knots. **WZA** should be set to 110 knots. **SRP** should be set to 130 knots when they enter the scenario.
**WZA** will enter at 4000ft. **LOU** is a VFR aircraft at 3500ft. LOU can be used for VFR flight following, or provide WZA traffic on unidentified and unverified traffic.
**AYZ** departs YGWA for YMLD, planned via the AD VOR at 6000ft. Either discuss with student prior what you can do e.g. get them higher, vector them around, don't let them enter CTA etc. or let them work it themselves.
**QFA590** departs to increase clutter with **FDG** and **RXA3458**. Shortly after, **QFA723** departs to conflict with **RXA3458**.
**RXA3458** is assigned FL160 for separation with FDG and should be coordinated to student as such.**
**SRP** is a VFR C182. May require sequencing depending on how the scenario is flowing.
**ZLE**, **JST682** and **VOZ9932** arrive to force sequencing.
**CEY** is for a VFR coastal transit of the CTR, not above 500ft. They should request clearance prior to reaching PNL and be processed as per AD SOPs by the student (identified, cleared coastal northbound off shore not above 500ft, clearance limit BTJ, then transferred to Tower who will remove clearance limit and clear them northbound before handing them back to student). Instructor will be prompted to request clearance. Control services should be cancelled approaching OHB.
The remainder of traffic is relatively straight forward and prompted for departures.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Melbourne Runway 16
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Melbourne Approach.
Melbourne is running Runway 16 for arrivals, Runway 27 for departures. Avalon is favouring Runway 18. Instrument approaches are in use at all locations.
Melbourne Tower, Benalla, and Yarrowee are online. Avalon Tower is closed.
There is no significant weather within the TMA, although thunderstorms to the north of Melbourne have made enroute sequencing difficult. As a result, you may need to conduct last minute sequencing within your airspace.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All departures from YMML are already activated (assumes ML TWR online). Departures from YMAV are not activated.
**LOI** is tracking to Bendigo and will generally request flight following from ML APP. No FDR exists for this aircraft, so student can either quick tag or create an FDR.
**EXG** is intended to pass overhead YMML at an awkward level, requiring action from student. Student is expected to intervene prior to issuing airways clearance, by offering climb or amended route. If reroute is offered, student should advise aircraft to: *"Expect clearance tracking via XXXXX, no reported IFR traffic"*. Instructor should direct aircraft to track direct to that point at that time. When clearance is available, student should indicate that the aircraft is: *"Cleared to YMMB via amended XXXXX, YYYYY, MB, enter controlled airspace at A035"*. Tracking `DCT DARLY MB DCT` generally keeps EXG clear, but any other suitable route is acceptable.
**WHB** has planned a transit of the ML CTA at A015 and will require the student to identify them, issue clearance (if available), and cancel identification/control services once clear of CTA. Initial call from WHB generally takes the form of: *"Melbourne Approach, WHB, C172, 5nm SW of FGN, A015, received November, for YHOT via FGN, request clearance"*.
**QFA6202** should be instructed to descend no lower than A060 until laterally clear of the YMML departure track, due autorelease in operation. Their descent profile will put them at roughly FL190 crossing the Runway 27 DOSEL SID, so consider vertical separation assurance requirements with departures from YMML.
**VOZ1755** will generally conflict with aircraft on the BOOIN STAR and require aggressive speed control on first contact and/or vectors to the east to slot in behind.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Melbourne - Milk Run
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
ML TMA "Milk Run" Scenario
**HANDOVER** - **Runway**: 16A27D. Expect Instrument Approach. - **Airspace**: - ML ADC, BLA, MUN Online. - MB, EN, AV ADCs Offline. - No top-down service. - **Weather**: Information N. Cloud BKN040. QNH 1013. - **Frequencies**: 132.0 only - **Traffic**: - Several arrivals through BOOIN - One arrival through ARBEY, and one through RAZZI, still over 30 mins away. Not yet assessed. - All departures except BNZ1023 are via DOSEL - Of note, ANZ1984 is a B77W that will be off Runway 16 - There is a BAe 146 taxiing that could create a faster following scenario.
Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
- If you are late to any of the timed takeoffs, try to wait at least 90 seconds until the next takeoff for spacing
- The aircraft should naturally arrive at the feeder fix with separation, but if the student applies any strange speed control to aircraft via coordination, ensure that speeds for other aircraft are adjusted as required to maintain separation at BOOIN
- **VOZ886** and **QJE1546** require sequencing
- **RXA466**, **QLK47**, and **8AX** require sequencing
- **JST611** is a **YMAV** arrival, easy for the student to miss if they're not paying attention - **MRNR01** is also a YMAV arrival. The two aircraft will not be a conflict in CTA, but they will be traffic for arrival
- **BNZ1023** departs to conflict with **JST611**
- **ANZ1984** departs Runway 16 **Off-Mode**. Feel free to add some personality to your radio calls, extend your "uuHhhh" in your call, make some comments about the wind or turbulence, advise your planned mach number, you know the drill
- This is shortly followed by **QFA7354** (a B462) in front of a faster following **QFA490** (A332). All 3 aircraft require separation management
- **BSV** Will call at 15 minutes requesting flight following. It is imperative that the student **rejects** this request due to controller workload. - If the Student Provides the SIS, **BSV** will STCA with reciprocal VFR traffic **UOR**. If the student attempts to provide traffic information between the two aircraft, take avoiding action. **UOR** is assumed to be listening on frequency.
- If the student has handled the ANZ1984 vs QFA7354 vs QFA490 well, throw in a **go-around**
- On the other hand, if the student needs some breathing room, delete aircraft in the following priority: 1. TFX22 2. RXA466 3. BSV Cancel Flight Following 4. 8AX

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Sydney Runway 34L/R
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Sydney Approach.
Sydney is running Runway 34 Left and Right for arrivals and departures. Bankstown is favouring Runway 11C. Instrument approaches (or Independent Visual Approaches - *instructor discretion*) are in use.
Sydney Tower, Bindook, Armidale, and Yarrowee are online. Bankstown Tower, Camden Tower, and Richmond Tower are closed.
There is no significant weather within the TMA, although thunderstorms to the west of Sydney have made enroute sequencing difficult for Bindook. As a result, you may need to conduct last minute sequencing within your airspace.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
**AM253** needs to be coordinated to the student due to their tracking. They can be instructed to leave controlled airspace descending (for a visual approach) or tracked via RAKSO for the RNP RWY 11C when on APP frequency.
There are significant sequencing issues between aircraft on the RIVET STAR (student will need to issue speed reduction quickly to certain aircraft).
**RXA6852** and **PE121** should be departed on the standard assignable heading (H230) without coordination as per autorelease procedures.
**WFE** (IFR departure from YSBK) can conflict with **AM253** and/or **REW** depending on when they are departed. *Important: student to ensure lateral separation exists between the BK8 SID and the arrival track prior to issuing clearance, or get arrival to downgrade to VFR, or withhold clearance to departure*.
**REW** is a VFR aircraft tracking via TWRN for YSBK. They will need descent to remain below the CTA steps. They can request flight following to increase student workload.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Sydney Runway 34L/R - Advanced
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Sydney Approach.
Sydney is running Runway 34 Left and Right for arrivals and departures. Bankstown is favouring Runway 11C. Instrument approaches (or Independent Visual Approaches - *instructor discretion*) are in use.
Sydney Tower, Bindook, Armidale, and Yarrowee are online. Bankstown Tower, Camden Tower, and Richmond Tower are closed.
There is no significant weather within the TMA, although thunderstorms to the west of Sydney have made enroute sequencing difficult for Bindook. As a result, you may need to conduct last minute sequencing within your airspace.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
This is a busy scenario with arrivals on all STARs. Students should be instructed to review Sydney Terminal SOPs to determine descent level assignment techniques to ensure vertical separation is maintained between aircraft on the RIVET/ODALE and BOREE/MEPIL STARs. The runway 34R arrivals are perfectly sequenced if kept at profile speed.
**HSZ** should be departed ASAP. This aircraft gives the student exposure to YSSY Helicopter operations. If they are departed early, there will be very little other aircraft in the TMA. All that is required is that the student identifies the aircraft and cancels their control/identification service as they pass DHH (Darling Harbour).
**YOE** should request clearance ASAP. They will request the Bondi 5 Southbound (coded clearance) and should request the Maroubra 5 Inbound (coded clearance) as they pass abeam about Bondi (first bay south of SYHD). The Tower controller will issue a VSA clearance, so once they are handed to TWR, instruct the aircraft to descend to 0.
**VEF** is for an overfly of TESAT and descend into Shellharbour. They can request direct to an RNP IAF or join the circuit. Expect them to reach top of descent approx 25nm north of TESAT.
**AM213** needs to be coordinated to the student due to their tracking. They can be instructed to leave controlled airspace descending (for a visual approach) or tracked via RAKSO for the RNP RWY 11C when on APP frequency.
There are significant sequencing issues between aircraft on the RIVET STAR (student will need to issue speed reduction quickly to certain aircraft).
**RXA6852** and **PE121** should be departed on the standard assignable heading (H230) without coordination as per autorelease procedures.
**WFE** (IFR departure from YSBK) can conflict with **AM213** and/or **REW** depending on when they are departed. *Important: student to ensure lateral separation exists between the BK8 SID and the arrival track prior to issuing clearance, or get arrival to downgrade to VFR, or withhold clearance to departure*.
**REW** is a VFR aircraft tracking via TWRN for YSBK. They will need descent to remain below the CTA steps. They can request flight following to increase student workload.

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Sydney - Milk Run
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
**HANDOVER** - **Runway**: - 16 PROPS - Expect Independent Visual Approach. - **Airspace**: - ARL, GUN and WOL online - We've Coordinated to GUN to allow 16L arrivals to be assigned the ODALE STAR strategically - Other SY TCU controller online, controlling airspace as discussed - SY ADC online - BK, CN, RIC ADC all offline - **Weather**: - Information A - Cloud BKN030 - QNH 1013 - **Frequencies**: - 124.4 (If Approach) only - 123.0 (If Departures) only - **Traffic**: - Several arrivals through RIVET for 16R - VOZ986 through BOREE is followed by FD233 through MEPIL, both for 16L - Several aircraft taxiing, mostly via WOL, although there is QFA11 that is off 16R for the North-West. - There's also a BAe 146 off 16L taxiing that could create a faster following scenario.
Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
- This exercise is NOT DESIGNED for one controller! It is to be completed with **two** controllers in Sydney TCU, with the Instructor managing the rest of the airspace. After completion of the handover, you may either ask the student how they would like to administer the airspace between the two controllers, or decide the ideal split for them (See 3rd line). - The exercise is designed so that that they can either do an Approach run, or a Departures run. - The *Training* portion of the Departures Run only goes for about 25-30 minutes. - The *Training* portion of the Arrivals Run lasts for the whole exercise (45-50 minutes). - The **ideal** splits are: - Controller 1: - **SAS** - **SFW** - **SFE** - Controller 2: - **SAN** - **SDS** - **SDN** - **SRI** - Use the **Level Change** function rather than the **Cleared Level** function for arrivals, as the simulator has difficulty calculating descent paths when being vectored.
**TRAFFIC NOTES**
- **QFA479** and **JST531** will depart from the parallel runways at the same time to cause a conflict at WOL - **QFA11** and **JTE7445** will depart from the parallel runways at the same time. - **QFA11** needs to get to the North-West for KLAX, crossing the 16L departure path, and MARLN arrival path. - They climb slowly, so it is challenging to get them above the REP area. - The *most ideal* solution is to restrict them below **JTE7445**, step climbing them underneath, and put on an easterly heading. - **JTE7445** may also create conflicts due to their slow speed on climb (especially above A100) - **JST766** departs for YPAD. **SID Level Restrictions** will keep them clear of arriving traffic, unless the student does anything weird. - **QLK265** via MARLN will need to be sequenced in with other 16L arrivals. - **ANZ107** via MARLN will need to be sequenced in with 16R arrivals. There is no natural gap in the sequence for them. - **QFA7335**, **QFA482**, and **VOZ891**, will all arrive via ODALE for Runway 16L. Will need to overfly the field to join mid-field downwind. - **AE974** taxis at YSBK for the South via WOL. They depart underneath 16R arrivals, and need to cross over the RIVET/ODALE arrival track. - The student should allow the aircraft to depart and hold them at a suitable level underneath 16R arrivals (Somewhere between A030-A050 is ideal). - The absolutely **perfect** solution would be to Cancel the SID, Coordinate and clear the aircraft on a Southerly heading up to A050, then climb them further once clear of the arrivals path to the South. - Witholding clearance to the aircraft is an option, however they do have **MEDEVAC** status, so it is not preferred. - If the student needs some breathing room, delete aircraft in the following priority: 1. **QFA11** 2. **AE974** 3. **ANZ1984** 4. **RXA182**

ScenarioFile.Name: TMA Tasmania
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing: You are operating HB_APP extending to LT_APP. HUO, HB_TWR and LT_TWR are all online. Hobart is running runway 12 for arrivals and departures, ILS approaches in use, with the cloud overcast at 800ft and passing showers. The Hobart QNH is 1019. Launceston is running runway 14R with cloud scattered at 7,600ft and QNH 1018. Large amounts of traffic are expected at both aerodromes.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
**ALL DEPARTURES ARE AUTOMATIC**
HB ILS RWY 12
LT RNAV-Z or VSA RWY 14R
CBDG RWY 12
All jets have been given a STAR for Hobart by HUO. Jets into LT have been cleared direct to the IAF for the RNAV-Z.
**YJG** from HB to LT first, this will cause some conflict with arriving jet traffic. They are coming in from an angle that can't be given a straight in approach without a sector entry or vectors. It's up to the student to recognise this and see what they can do (conduct the DME/GNSS Arrival into a visual circling is prefered).
**SND1** enters TMA tracking for the IAF for the RNAV-Z 12, cleared to leave and re-enter CTA on descent to 6000ft when ready.
**CUY** requires airways clearance on first contact with student and tracking for the RNAV-Z.
**FWC** is receiving flight following from HUO and is for a VFR Transit overhead LT. This conflicts with **VOZ1090** on the approach. Student to assess conflict and assign vertically separated levels/clearance limit to FWC/withhold clearance to FWC as necessary. HUO should coordinate with student.
**AM214** causes conflict with **UJA** which will require vectoring.
**UJA** is for Cambridge via the MORGO1A then ILS into HB (This needs coordination), then once visual join final for 12 at Cambridge. They'll need a clearance to enter CTA at HB by the student.
*Be careful using the cleared when ready descent mode into YMHB, aircraft seem to go missed so be ready to delete them*
**METARs:**
YMHB: YMHB AUTO 17012KT 5000 +SHRA OVC008 03/04 Q1019
YMLT: YMLT AUTO 18009KT 9999 // SCT076 08/06 Q1018
**Important Airspace Note**
Aircraft conducting the ILS or VOR approach at YMLT from the south are unable to descend below MSA of 5800ft until the IAF (although commencement altitude ranges from 3000ft to 4000ft depending on the approach). Aircraft must either descend via the DGA until the IAF of the ILS/VOR, then commence that approach, or be descended on the MVA by Approach to 3100ft, then commence approach from there. If choosing to descend via the DGA, then commence the ILS/VOR approach, the student should use the following phraseology:
*'Descend 3000ft not below the DME steps, cleared ILS Runway 32L approach'*

ScenarioFile.Name: Enroute TBD
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
**HANDOVER** - **Runway**: - 05 at YPAD - Expect Visual Approach. - **Airspace**: - AD APP, ASP, MUN Online - **Weather**: - Benign - QNH 1013 - **Frequencies**: - 123.05 only - **Traffic**: - RXA4356 needs descent for YPLC - TGG317 and QFA1969 are estimating KAKLU at the same time, require sequencing - Several arrivals via MAVTO as well. RXA489 and VOZ223 are on top of each other, will require sequencing - QFA648 crossing to the North, not yet assessed - Two taxiing for YMML, One taxiing for YSSY - All other not yet assessed
Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes: - **TGG317** and **QFA1969** will require sequencing through KAKLU - **QFA685**, **RXA489**, **VOZ223**, and **JST766** will require sequencing through INTOG - When Student is selecting how to order the sequence, they would benefit from taking note of the level order (ie, make lower aircraft Number 1) - **QLK270** will taxi at YPLC 10 minutes in. Will require mutual traffic with **RXA4356** - **SIA7297** will cross to the North West at F360 - **JST499** inbound via KAKLU will be in conflict. This should be resolved with coordination, or level change on first contact - **JST765** will depart YPAD to be in conflict with **SIA7297**. A Restriction should be imposed, or assigned a level underneath - **QFA648** will request climb to F390 when in lateral conflict with **SIA7297** - **UTY3136** will depart at 5 minutes. - They will be in conflict with **QFA648**. This can be solved vertically, or with track shortening for both aircraft. - They will also request tracking for the RNP Approach at YOLD - **XLQ** will request Flight Following for YADG at 15 minutes. The student should reject this due controller workload, unless they are absolutely nailing the scenario. - **QFA7354** (B462) will depart at 27 minutes, followed closely by **QFA746** (B738). The student will need to recognise and take action to solve the faster following scenario

ScenarioFile.Name: Enroute TRT
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Territory.
Darwin is running Runway 29. Instrument approaches are in use at all locations.
Darwin Approach and ISA are online.
There is no significant weather within your airspace.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
**ALL YPDN DEPARTURES ARE AUTOMATIC**
Ensure the student disables GRIB winds.
For newish students you can just run TRT.
If you have a more advanced student have them extend to ARA. This adds more OCTA aircraft.
Constant stream out of YPDN which will cause conflicts down the line.
**RNG** is a VFR who needs to request either flight following or an upgrade to IFR. He will drop out of radar coverage eventually so make sure the student deals with it accordinly.
Depart **HVH** and **JFO** as soon as practical. These provide departure OCTA procedures for the student and won't become identified until around A100.
**JFO** and **JVN** will be opposite direction in the cruise.
Have Fun

ScenarioFile.Name: Enroute GUN
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating GUN. WOL has released the CB TCU to you.
YSSY is running 34 PROPS. YSCB is using Runway 35 only. Instrument approaches are in use at all locations.
SY APP and CB ADC are online
All surrounding Enroute sectors are online.
There is no significant weather within your airspace.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
This is an Entry level Enroute sequencing scenario.
Due to their positions, **YMA03** and **RXA32** should be handed off to student when session begins.
**SIA221** naturally estimates RIVET at similar time to **QFA501**. If track shortening is given to SIA221, vertical separation assurance may be required with YMA03. Student should assume SIA221 at scenario start (even though they are slightly outside jurisdiction).
**AM231** (departure from YSDU) should be departed early for best effect. Student is expected to issue STAR clearance (but no runway assignment) with airways clearance after departure report (see MUN SOPs page). Once aircraft is established in the sequence, runway assignment should be given (see gun SOPs page).
**QFA501** and **JST795** have built-in conflict, requiring speed control, track shortening to QFA501, or vectors. Can also be used to demonstrate a hold.
**WFE** (departure from YBTH) should be departed early. **REW** (departure from YGLB) is best utilised by departing when WFE is within 10 min of GLB, creating the need to pass IFR traffic to both aircraft.

ScenarioFile.Name: Enroute BLA
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing: **HANDOVER** - **Runway**: - 16 for arrivals YMML. 17 for Arrivals YSCB - **Airspace**: - All Surrounding Enroute sectors online - ML APP and CB APP Online - AY ADC Offline - **Weather**: - Benign - Information N at YMML. QNH 1013 - Information A at YSCB. QNH 1013 - **Frequencies**: - 132.2 only - **Traffic**: - No one in our airspace at the moment - Multiple aircraft for YMML shortly calling from YSSY. No separation issues, however sequencing will be required - Multiple departures planned out of YMML for the North West. Watch out for **TFX11**, a slow BAe 146. - Watch the YMML departures with QFA64 overflying from the South West. Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
**ALL YMML/YSCB DEPARTURES ARE AUTOMATIC**
Initial cluster of traffic inbound from YSSY starts. Student will need to initiate sequencing quickly. - Important to issue STAR Clearances on first contact
**EVY30** departs YSCB for YMAV. A student may easily assume they are for YMML - Best solution is to get them west of Q29, DCT ML - Vertically above the YMML sequence is also an option, but higher workload - If the student keeps them below the YMML sequence and on flight planned route, they're screwed - Also requires heads-up coordination to ML APP no matter what tracking the student chooses
**ASY10** cuts straight through the Q29 corridor at BULLA - Will be in lateral conflict with multiple YMML arrivals - Will likely work on profile if the arrivals are assigned **F200** prior to passing **ASY10**, however, it would be close - Most optimal solution is to Track Shorten **ASY10** to allow more room for the YMML arrivals descent profile
**AM213** and **QLK39D** will conflict at TEMIS - Clearing **AM213** DCT COLDS solves the conflict with **QLK39D** and the entire YMML sequence - Heads-up coordination is required to ML APP for **AM213**
**QLK39D** arrives at the FF around the same time as the **VOZ443** - The sequence could go either way, but getting VOZ443 to overtake QLK39D is quite high workload. As such, **QLK39D** as Number 1 is the most optimal solution
A steady flow of aircraft will be departing YMML for YSSY/YSBK - **TFX11**, a **B462**, departs first. If no action is taken, it will have a loss of separation with **TFR44**
**QFA64** flies straight overhead ML for YSSY - They are at Non-Standard **F360** - They will be in conflict with many departures requesting above **F360**. The Faster following aspect may also catch out the student - Lowest workload and most equitable solution is to just assign **F350** to the departures in conflict with **QFA64** - An alternative option, but higher workload, is to take **QFA64** left of route, DCT NONUP or CULIN, to achieve lateral separation prior to cruise - The highest workload solution of vectoring the departures to achieve their requested level would be disastrous
It is highly unlikely the student will be able to manage all of this traffic effectively. If they are falling behind, delete a few aircraft causing issues and advise the student

ScenarioFile.Name: Enroute ASP
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
**HANDOVER** - **Runway**: - No Runways - **Airspace**: - All Surrounding Enroute sectors online - AS ADC Offline - WR ADC Offline - **Weather**: - Benign - Area QNH 1013 - **Frequencies**: - 128.85 only - **Traffic**: - Starting from the East - We have 6 aircraft for YSSY via **VELGI** - **QFA1043** and **QFA2** need action - **AIC302** and **MAS123** need action - **GIA712** and **VOZ874** are at the same level, but 3 minutes apart at VELGI - **TGG317** and **EVY30** cross over all of them. Everyone's at standard levels, so no additional conflicts there - **QTR3X** is opposite direction and close with **TMN014**, 1000ft apart - **JST664** needs descent in to YAYE, in conflict with **TMN014**. Some action required for that. - **QFA838** northbound - **JTE505** southbound non-RVSM, no conflicts at the moment - **VOZ1743** and **JST043** calling shortly, no conflicts - I haven't spoken to **TBD** yet about **JST043** to see if they have any restrictions or requirements. - **VOZ717** and **QFA643** westbound, no conflicts - **MXD196** and **JST972** 2000ft apart, opposite direction with **VOZ592**. All standard levels - **QFA642** eastbound, no conflicts - **JST968** shortly calling eastbbound, no conflicts - All other announced tracks not yet assessed
Any Questions?
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes: - The exercise won't run out of aircraft for a long while. You can run it for anywhere between 40 minutes to an hour, and there will be sufficient learning outcomes to keep it going if you want. - There are several aircraft in the exercise that do nothing and create no conflicts. They are simply there to add screen clutter. - **JST664** will be in conflict with **TMN014** for their descent in to YAYE. Student should descend **JST664** underneath **TMN014** prior to crossing. - **JST043** clips a small portion of **TBD** airspace. - The student should call **TBD** to ask if they have any *Restrictions or Requirements*. - If the student tries to handoff the aircraft to **TBD**, call **ASP** as **TBD**, and advise you have *No Restrictions or Requirements*. - There are 6 aircraft tracking via **VELGI** for YSSY in close proximity. - **QFA1043** and **QFA2** require action. - **AIC302** and **MAS123** require action. - **VOZ874** and **GIA712** are at the same level, however have 3 minutes longitudinal separation at **VELGI**, so no action required. - **TGG317** **and EVY30** are also in lateral conflict with most of these aircraft too, so non-standard F380 and F400 are not available. - The best solution is to track shorten **QFA1043** and **AIC302** DCT **MAKKA**. - **JST978** from YBCS to YPPH conflicts with **SIA256** and **QFA838** at F380. **JST978** should be coordinated at an amended level. - Throughout the exercise, surveillance coverage will be lost on **MXD196**, **JST971**, and **VOZ592**. The student should verbally terminate their identification, and request an estimate for their next point. - At 2:30, **JST971** requests F380, the same level as **MXD196** 5 minutes in front. - Although they are both currently identified, the aircraft will lose surveillance approaching VIBUX. - It would be prudent to reject the request, however you may discuss how you could separate them procedurally using a distance standard (and why that would unneccesarily create a much higher workload) - **VOZ592** is opposite direction at F370, preventing the use of that non-standard level for **JST971** - At 5:00, **QFA1957** taxis at YBAS for YPAD. - They will climb slowly, which will require monitoring to ensure they climb above **TMN014**. - At 26:40, they will request a block clearance in conflict with **VOZ1743**. The clearance should be denied, however they can expect it to be available in 20 minutes when clear of the traffic. - At 10:00, **QTR3X** request a block clearance, in conflict with **TMN014**. The clearance should be denied, however they can expect it to be available in 30 minutes when clear of the traffic. - At 11:00, **EVY30** will request F430 on first contact. This creates no conflicts. - At 15:00, **QFA729** will call taxiing YAYE, opposite direction with **JST664**. - The two aircraft will pass in controlled airspace, so the student should tell **QFA729** to expect clearance via an amended route to achieve lateral separation (*AVMON GOMUL* or *ANGAS GOMUL* work well) - At 25:00, **PFY9381** taxis at YCDU for YPAD. - At 25:00, **QFA838** will request track shortening. It creates no conflicts. - At 26:40, **JTE505** will request a weather deviation. They are non-RVSM, so this will place them in conflict with **JST043**. Student should either offer a deviation Right of route, or an amended level (Aircraft can accept either). - At 35:00, **VOZ1743** requests DCT DOTUM for the RNP Approach. This creates no conflicts. **VOZ1743** will be traffic with **QFA1958** inbound to YBAS from the north.

ScenarioFile.Name: Oceanic TSN
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
- **QFA142**: Set Departure time to 1 Hour and 13 Minutes Prior. Set ETA for OLREL 15 Minutes in the future.
- **ANZ123**: Set Departure time to 1 Hour and 10 Minutes Prior. Set ETA for SASRO 15 Minutes in the future.
- **AWK7**: Set Departure time to 55 Minutes Prior. Set ETA for OMKIN 9 Minutes in the future.
- **JST223** and **VOZ161** have less than 10 mins longitudinal separation. The student will need to either implement a distance standard, or vertical separation (Discuss the benefits and drawbacks of each option).
- **TMN8**, **VOZ161**, and **JST223** are conflicting at MIKEG. Discuss the various ways to solve this (Vertically, Conflict Area, Longitudinally).
- **QFA142** will request a weather deviation shortly after arriving on frequency, that places them in conflict with **QFA149** due to their non-RVSM status. Discuss the various options to solve this, such as: - *"QFA142, I have conflicting traffic in that direction. Will 30nm left of route keep you clear of the weather?"* - *"QFA142, I have conflicting traffic in that direction. Will deviations right of route keep you clear of the weather?"* - *"QFA142, I have conflicting traffic in that direction. Deviation is available at Non-Standard F390 or F350. Advise your preferred."*
- At around 13 minutes, **AWK7** will request a level that places them in conflict with **MXD195**. Discuss options to solve, such as: - Conflict Area to implement restriction - Restriction prior to 10 mins from ETP - Wait until aircraft have passed
Have Fun

ScenarioFile.Name: Tower Moorabbin
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Moorabbin Tower.
Moorabbin Ground is offline, Melbourne Approach is online.
Runways 17L and R are in use.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All arrivals are auto-timed and prompted. Currently you have to descend aircraft manually. All aircraft should be AT 500 feet by their base turn in order to land correctly. Additionally you will have to manually select the runway and arm the approach for XPV, inbound from the north. All departures are not auto-timed, and can be used at your discretion, each aircraft has the following role;
**VCY** is an inbound from Carrum for a downwind join to 17L. They will track laterally to join the circuit, you must descend them manually.
**BZE** is an outbound VFR, no explicit airways clearance is required.
**VCI** is for circuits.
**BRY** is also for circuits, can be introduced later in the scenario in order to introduce multiple aircraft in the circuit.
**YZU** is an IFR Seminole, they require airways clearance and heads up coordination with TMA.
**DTF** inbound from GMH (each letter pronounced on the radio). They will track laterally to join the circuit, you must descend them manually.
**POL36** is for an overfly through the class D airspace from the south east. The student can issue the clearance by simply acknowledging the callsign or providing a normal airways clearance
**XPV** IFR Citation Longitude inbound from the north for the RNP Runway 17L. They must be heads up coordinated by TMA.
**EOK** VFR outbound for the Training Area via Upwind

ScenarioFile.Name: Tower Sydney 34L and R (S2)
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
You are operating Sydney Tower. Ground and Delivery are online.
Runway 34L and R are in use for arrivals and departures. IVA's are in use.
Sydney Approach is online.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All arrivals are cleared the approach and will land automatically.
HSZ is a Helicopter Departure via Harbour Bridge 5. Tower should give the clearance and take-off. Both prompts are auto timed.
All departures 34L are ready on Alpha.
All departures 34R are ready on B10 holding short Sierra. Will require student to taxi aircraft to T6 without conflicting with arrivals
QFA721 and VOZ429 are holding short 34L on Lima to cross for full length. Ground (you) will request runway crossings accordingly later in the scenario.
QLK227D is an intersection departure from B10 for 34L
QFA464 is too close to TGG264 and conflicts. Student will need to identify this and either slow down QFA464 or issue a go around.
To add to the fun, JIO is for circuits RWY 34R. Student will need to coordinate release of airspace for circuits, and subsequently separate JIO from arriving traffic (visual sep.) He has been placed Holding point T5, and can call up ready whenever the instructor feels like it.
Have fun :)

ScenarioFile.Name: Ground Melbourne 27AD/34D
ScenarioFile.StudentBriefing:
GRIB winds are disabled in this scenario. In vatSys, select Settings > GRIB Winds > Disable Globally.
You are operating Melbourne Ground. Delivery is offline.
Runway 27 is in use for arrivals. Runway 34 (via MNG, NONIX and DOSEL) and runway 27 (all others) for departures. Instrument approaches are in use due to a low cloud base.
Melbourne Approach and Melbourne Tower are online.
ScenarioFile.InstructorNotes:
All arrivals are cleared the approach and will land automatically. Arrivals from the east may briefly lose identification approaching BOOIN due terrain. They will return prior to entering the TMA.
Arrivals on Runway 27 might be slightly misaligned from the runway, due to simulator contraints. This shouldn't affect the flow or potential conflicts.
You probably won't be able to clear all the departures, as this scenario gets very busy. Lots of opportunities for conflicting taxi routes, so order of departures should also not make a massive difference.
